DOC.detailed_description: Aim : To determine whether addition audio-visual presentation standard physician interaction improve patient comprehension relate information provide informed consent process patient undergo hysterectomy . Design : This randomize controlled trial compare standard physician interaction ( control arm ) standard physician interaction plus audio-visual presentation ( experimental arm ) inform consent process patient undergo hysterectomy determine effectiveness audio-visual presentation patient comprehension . All subject undergo knowledge questionnaire four separate time point - prior preoperative appointment , immediately preoperative appointment , day surgery , six-week follow-up visit . The control group consent standard fashion face-to-face interaction surgeon . The intervention group watch 10-minute scripted video explain procedure , risk , benefit , expectation , long term complication relate hysterectomy face-to-face interaction surgeon . Patients arm sign standard pre-surgical informed consent form undergoing procedure . All interaction physician ( control experimental ) audiotaped assess number patient question , time spent patient , quality subject material discuss control group . Subjects also receive satisfaction questionnaire preoperative visit . Setting : Research take place gynecology clinic surgical suite San Antonio Military Medical Center . Subjects : Approximately 120 subject recruit San Antonio Military Medical Center gynecology clinic ( 50 arm ) . Eligible subject include patient scheduled hysterectomy without salpingo-oophorectomy benign indication , civilian military , female , old 18yo , English-speaking , intact hear vision , able provide consent without representation . Measures : In study , patient literacy determine use REALM score ( Rapid Estimate Adult Literacy Medicine ) . Patient knowledge questionnaire create investigator study . Satisfaction measure validated questionnaire ( CSQ-8 ) . Primary objective address analysis subject ' difference score comprehension assessment four time point . Secondary objective include patient satisfaction , time spent physician face-to-face interaction , question ask patient , quality physician counseling ( inclusion key item control arm ) also analyze group .
